com.sap.conn.jco.ext

Interface SessionEventListener


  • public interface SessionEventListener
    The SessionEventListener interface reacts on the events that a SessionReferenceProvider will fire, if a session reference was changed in some way. Events allow to improve the performance and resource management in JCo session management. If a SessionReferenceProvider claims to support the events, JCo actually relies on them and does not check whether a session is still alive after the configured check period. The omission of these checks of course improves the performance, but if the SessionReferenceProvider does not fire the events as it should, then we might get a resource leak with lots of unused connections remaining open for a long time.

    If the SessionReferenceProvider implementation is not able to support events, JCo regularly checks all sessions that are known to its runtime, whether the session identified by the passed ID is still known to the session management component.This is done using the method SessionReferenceProvider.isSessionAlive(String). But even in case events are supported, JCo will still check for zombie sessions that might have come into existence in the JCo runtime because of some "omitted/forgotten" event. However, these checks will occur only, if the internal session context is recognized as idle for a time longer than the configured session timeout.

    Note: The implementation for this interface is provided by the JCo runtime. If a SessionReferenceProvider returns true for supportsEvents(), JCo registers the implementation for this interface via the SessionReferenceProvider.setSessionEventListener(SessionEventListener) API.

    Since:
    JCo 3.1.0
    See Also:
    SessionReferenceProvider

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finished(String sessionID)
      This event needs to be fired by session management, if a session has ended.

    • Method Detail

      • finished

        void finished(String sessionID)
        This event needs to be fired by session management, if a session has ended. As a consequence, JCo will cleanup the associated resources immediately, i.e. all destinations, which were set to stateful within this session and which already keep connections in the corresponding session context, will release those connections. Furthermore, all running function module executions will be canceled independent of whether the corresponding destination had been set to stateful or not.
        Parameters:
        sessionID - the session ID of the scope/session that has finished
